turns.speaker: FAT CLOWN
turns.text: Ten, nine...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: The Christmas Eve of Destruction -- !

turns.speaker: FAT CLOWN
turns.text: ... eight, seven...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Silent night, violent night...

turns.speaker: FAT CLOWN
turns.text: All is shrill, all is blight...

turns.speaker: FAT CLOWN
turns.text: Well, um... funny thing, your penguins... they're not responding to the launch command.  Fact they're kind of turned around now... Like someone jammed our signal...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: But who could've ... no, don't say it.

turns.speaker: FAT CLOWN
turns.text: My lips are sealed.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Actually this is all just a bad dream.  You're home in bed. Heavily sedated, resting comfortably, and dying from the carcinogens you've personally spewed in a lifetime of profiteering. Tragic irony or poetic justice? You tell me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: My god ... it's true.  The Penguin- Man of the sewers ... Please, don't h--

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Quiet, Max.  What do you think, this is a conversation?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What, is that supposed to "hypnotize" me?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: No, just give you a splitting headache.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well it's not working.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Most of all, I want to find out who I am.  By finding my parents. Learning my "human" name.  Simple stuff that the good people of Gotham take for granted.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And exactly <u>why</u> am <u>I</u> gonna help <u>you</u>?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yawn.  That coulda come from anywhere.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: What about the documents that prove you own half the firetraps in Gotham?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If there were such documents -- and that is not an admission -- I would have seen to it they were shredded.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: A lot of tape and a little patience make all the difference.  By the way, how's Fred Adkins, your old partner?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fred.  Fred?  He's ... actually he's been on an extended vacation, and --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know what, Mr. ... Penguin-Sir? I think perhaps I could help orchestrate a little welcome-home scenario for you.  And once we're both back home, perhaps we can help each other out ...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: You won't regret this, Mr. Shreck.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't look, Oswald.  It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: A big bag of fan mail?  Filthy lucre?  Wait don't tell me ... Is it a broad?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Bu ... wh ... I ... I mean ...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes, adulation is a cross to bear. God knows <u>I</u> know.  But someone's got to supplant our standing-in- the-way-of-progress Mayor and don't deny it, Mr. Cobblepot, you've got the magic!

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Max, elections happen in November. Is this not late December, or have I inhaled too much swamp gas in my time?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Wonder if it's worth my time.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We need signatures.  To overturn the ballot.  I can supply those, Oswald.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I could teach her my "French flipper" trick...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oswald:  We need one more thing.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: A platform?  Lemme see ... Stop global warming.  Start global cooling.  Make the world a colder place.  <u>Frigid</u> ...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's fine, Oswald.  But to get the Mayor recalled, we still need a catalyst, a trigger, an incident. Like the Reichstag fire, the Gulf of Tonkin.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: "You're doin' great, Mayor Cobblepot."  "Your table is ready, Mayor Cobblepot."  "I need you, Oswald.  I need you now.  That's the biggest parasol I ever --"

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Precisely.  But they must come and go via the plumbing ducts that I've provided.  That shall be as sacred as the separation between church and state.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: ... Want 'em to go apeshit.  Nutso. Ballistic ... Do permanent damage to little old ladies.  Loot, pillage, annoy people in a big way ...  <u>Sounds</u> fun.  But I ...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I got my own ... <u>quest</u> to pursue up here.  It's crucial I not get sidetracked, with some silly ...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sidetracked?  Oswald, this is your chance to fulfill a destiny that your parents carelessly discarded ...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Reclaim my birthright, y'mean?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Imagine:  You'll have the ear of the media.  Access to captains of industry.  Unlimited poon- tang ...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: He didn't even lose a limb, an eyeball ... bladder control ..

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Point is, listen to them.  They've lost faith in old symbols. They're ready to bond with you, the icon of the future.  If it works, don't fix it...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Max!  Relax!  Josh and Jen'll put a spin on this.  We'll talk it over tonight, at your costume par--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think you'd feel out of place at my party.  You see, it's for winners.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: You're coming with me, you Great White Dope!  To die, way down in the sewer!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not Chip!  Please!  Penguin ... If you have one iota of human feeling, you'll take me instead.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I don't.  So, no.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm the one you want!  Penguin, please!  Ask yourself:  Isn't it Max Shreck who manipulated and betrayed you?  Isn't it Max, not Chip, whom you want to see immersed up to his eyeballs in raw sewage?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Okay, you have a point.  Plus, the hysterics are getting on my nerves.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Working late?  I'm touched.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: No, I am.  Yes, I'm boning up for your Bruce Wayne meeting in the morning.  I pulled all the files on the proposed power plant, and Mr. Wayne's hoped-for investment... I've studied up on all of it ... I even opened the protected files and --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why, how industrious.  And how did you open protected files, may I ask?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Well I figured that your password was "Finster."  Your Pomeranian. And it was.  And it's all very interesting, though a bit on the technical side, I mean about how the power plant is a power plant in name only since in fact it's gonna be one big giant...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Big giant <u>capacitor</u>.  And that, instead of generating power it'll sort of be --  -- <u>sucking</u> power, from Gotham City, and storing it ... stockpiling it, sort of?  Which, unless I'm being dense, is a novel approach, I'd say.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And who ... would you say this <u>to</u>?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: ... Where did curiosity get the cat?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm no cat.  I'm just an assistant. A <u>secretary</u> --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And a very, very good one.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Too good?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: It's our secret.  Honest.  How can you be so mean to someone so meaningless?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I must protect my interests, Ms. Kyle.  And Interest Number One, is <u>moi</u>.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Okay, go ahead.  Intimidate me, bully me if it makes you feel big.  I mean, it's not like you can just kill me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Actually, it's a lot like that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Selina?!  Selina ... Selina ...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: That's my name, Maximillions. Don't wear it out, babe, or I'll make you buy me a new one.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh, Selina, this is, uh, Bruce Wayne.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Morning, Max.  Bummer about the store.  You insured?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I damn well better be.  In fact I want you to phone those goniffs over at Gotham Insurance and tell them --

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Actually I have to split.  Take a "personal day."  You don't mind? Max, you're tops.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: How long has it been, Uncle Alfred?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Ten years.  Barbara isn't really me niece, sir. She's Joanna Clark's daughter.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Joanna and I were in love in London. But when I realized our age difference was too extreme -

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Uncle Alfred left for America.  Much to my mother's dismay -

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Eventually she married a young physician.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: You certainly will not.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh no, those things frighten me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Uncle, I came to tuck you in.  And...

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: You came to tuck me in.  That's quite a switch.  I am looking for my brother, Wilfred. He is first butler to the Maharajah of Mirajanpore.  But Mirajanpore is a floating court, it travels across India, so Wilfred can be rather difficult to find.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I guess they don't have fax machines on elephants.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I have been trying to reach Wilfred with no success.  As one grows older, one yearns for family.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: It's good to see you again, Uncle. I've missed you.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: As I've missed you.  Sleep well, child.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I was too late.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Too late for what, dear child?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I came to give you your freedom, a chance to live the life you choose. The same gift you gave me.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I have been part of the greatest adventure ever know.  I have found purpose here, and the family I could never have.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Find my brother Wilfred.  Give him This.  I have duties he must fulfill in my stead.  Only family can be trusted.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: It is the hearts of two good men whom I have had the honor of calling son.  Take it, child.  But I implore you, never open it.  You look so like your mother.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Uncle Alfred?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: In spirit only, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: The boys need help.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He's over-eager, impulsive.  I can't trust him not to get hurt.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Perhaps the truth is you don't really trust anyone.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't tell me you're on his side. Again.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Despite all your talents, you are still a novice in the ways of family. Dick follows the same ends as you but gets there by his own course.  You must learn to trust him.  For that is the nature of family.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I must have dozed off.  My sincerest apologies, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No apology necessary.  That's the first time in thirty years.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You have?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Secrets are a virtual prerequisite in this house, don't you think?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well, I hope you'll stay with us.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: There's a lovely inn just down --

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Oh, but, sir.  So much goes on-

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't be silly, Alfred. After all, she's family.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Congratulations on your apprehension of Mr. Freeze.  Batman monopolized the evening news.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Is there something wrong, sir?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, am I pigheaded?  Is it always my way or the highway?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Why, yes, actually.  Death and chance stole your parents.  But rather than become a victim, you have done everything in your power to control the fates.  For what is Batman if not an effort to master the chaos that sweeps our world, an attempt to control death itself.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: But I can't can I?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: No, my boy.  I'm afraid none of us can.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I am as well as can be expected.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, I know you're sick -- I can get you the best doctors.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I've seen the best doctors--! A gentleman does not discuss his health.  It's not civilized.  I hope I've taught you at least that much, young man.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Have you ever regretted your life working here, Alfred?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Attending to heroes?  No sir.  My Only regret is that I was never able to be out there with you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not all heroes wear masks.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, if I've never told you...I just want to say...

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I've spent my whole life trying to beat back death.  What good are all my heroics now if I can't save you?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Everyone dies, Master Bruce.  There's no defeat in that.  Victory comes in fighting for what we know is right while we still live.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I love you, old man.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Remember this.  And remember it always.  I'm proud of you.  And I love you too, son.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, old friend, I could use your help right now.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Right here, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: What seems to be the problem?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Women.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: That, sir, does not compute.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: First Ivy had an intoxicating effect on both Dick and me.  Tonight my feelings spread to someone else.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Specify, please.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Pamela Isley.  I was so attracted to her I couldn't reason clearly.  I still can't.  She used to work for Wayne Enterprises.  Find a file.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Coming on line now, sir.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Advanced botany.  DNA splicing. Recombinant animal plant patterns. Pheromone extractions.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Pheromones?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Glandular secretions from animals. Scents that create powerful emotions.  Fear.  Rage...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Passion.  Of course.  Find the photo of Ivy after the flower ball.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: It appears, sir, that someone has stolen the batsignal.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, are you...?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Rather disappointed at how poorly I taught you proper housekeeping.  And quite well, it seems.  Thanks to you, son.  Thanks to you all.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm on break from-

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Oxbridge Academy?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Their new computer sciences division.  How did you know?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I recognized the accent.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Sometimes counting on someone else is the only way to win.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Hey, I'm the one who kicked Ivy's botanical butt.  Personally.  Me.  I did.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You are going back to school.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Please be looking for me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm so sorry to trouble you, but-

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Al's main squeeze.  Is she here?  I'm about to scrape the bottom of my shoe off my tongue, right?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: My parents were killed in an auto accident ten years ago.  Alfred has been supporting me ever since.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I could have made it, you know.  I didn't need your help.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Whatever you say, lady.  It's all in a day's work for me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: This is to replace the bike I lost. I'll get you the rest.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Keep it.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Of course, Dick Grayson, ward of the fabulously wealthy Bruce Wayne. Why would you need a few hundred dollars?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hey, what's your problem?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I guess, the truth is I'm just not comfortable with the idle rich.  Even when they try to act like heroes.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I started racing after my parents died.  There was something about the speed, the danger, that took me out of myself, that made the hurt go away.  You wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You'd be surprised.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Street racing isn't exactly an acceptable major at Oxbridge.  They kicked me out.  it doesn't matter. I've won enough money to do what I've always dreamed.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Just don't tell me you're hoping to run away and join the circus.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Alfred has supported me my whole life.  Now I'm going to pay him back. I'm going to liberate him from his dismal life of servitude.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Servants, Masters, it's  ridiculous. Alfred is the sweetest, most noble man alive and he's subjugated all his life and dreams to someone else.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Alfred and Bruce are like family.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Paying someone to prepare your meals and do your laundry and clean your dishes, you call that family?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Alfred's happy here.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Happy.  You honestly don't know, do you? You can't even see what's in front of your own eyes.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: Alpha.  Got it.  What the hell is attack plan Alpha?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Divide and conquer.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Youwsa!  Nothing but air.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: Batgirl, Baatgirl, Baatgirl.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: This is easy.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Crimefighter's rule number one: never say that.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Crimefighter's rule number two.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: I'm afraid to ask.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Be ready for anything.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: Pow!  What!  Kazow!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What exactly are you doing?

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: I don't know.  It just feels right.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: It'll take the satellites about a minute to re-align, but...damn!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Damn?  Damn is not good.

turns.speaker: BATGIRL
turns.text: Those targeting mirrors are frozen. The sun beam won't work.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: You were a great scientist once. Don't squander your genius on evil.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: I hate being lectured.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: After you have frozen, your icy tomb will plummet back to Gotham.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Freeze, you're mad.  This capsule will slaughter thousands.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Mr. Bane, I'll finish off the city. You, as they say in showbiz, are on.  Take the boys and kill the kids. But bring me the Bat.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: We have eleven minutes to stop Freeze And thaw the city.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: You're loosing your cool

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: I think not.  There'll be no hot time in this old town tonight.  You'll get a charge out of this.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Go on, kill me too.  Just as you killed my wife.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I didn't kill your wife.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Nice suit.  And today you are?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Nightwing.  Scourge of darkest evil.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: This is all about fashion for you, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It's the gear.  Chicks love the gear.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: ... A giant drilling truck burrowing under the city ...

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Mr. Freeze.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: The batcomputer tracks him heading for the Gotham Museum.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: The new antiquities exhibit.  The Second Sun of the Sudan.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Of course.  He's going to steal the giant white diamond.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No, Robin.  He's going to jail.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I was just hanging around.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I thought you were going to stay in the museum and round up the thugs.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: How about, nice to see you?  Glad you're here to save my life.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Watch the first step.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Surf's up.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You think Freeze will take the bait?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: He'll be here.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: You don't have two million.  Three million - -

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'll borrow it from you.  Four million - -

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Pull back.  You can't make the jump.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can make it.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: She's definitely part of this.  It's weird, for a while Ivy was all I could think about.  But then...

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I know.  The feeling just vanished.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't believe we were fighting over a  bad guy.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Bad, yes.  Guy, no.  This is one majorly beautiful evil person.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm totally over her.  Positively.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Me too.  Great stems, though.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Umm-hmmmm.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Definitely.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: How did you...?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Open Sesame...Chicken.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: She's still alive.  He's adapted his freezing technology to reverse McGregor's Syndrome.  He's even found a cure for the early stages of the disease.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Can he save her?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No.  Her case is too advanced.  But maybe, someday, with more research-

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No beauty...

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Just the beast.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Remember the victim at the airport. Toxins introduced through the mouth.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Why is she so desperate to kiss us? I'm betting her lips are poison.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: A poison kiss?  You have some real issues with women, you know that?  You just couldn't stand that she was about to kiss me.  Couldn't stand that something might be mine and not yours.  Could you?!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: We gotta get those locks changed.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: She knows who we are.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I guess we'll just have to kill her.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Kill her later.  We've got work to do.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No sign of the snowman.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Maybe he melted.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: If we could relay the sunlight-

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: From the other side of the equator-

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Winded, old timer?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Don't make me kill you in front of the girl.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: They're overly protective.  You're Not going to hurt me are you, Ms...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Dr. Pamela Isley.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What can I do for you, Doctor?  A research grant?  A hospital wing?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Actually, I already work for you. Or did.  Your arboreal preservation project in South America.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We cut our support.  A conflict of ideologies.  Dr. Woodrue was a lunatic.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I see you knew him.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That lab was consumed by fire last week.  how did you manage to escape?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I have here a proposal showing how Wayne Enterprises can immediately cease all actions that toxify our environment.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Forget the stars.  Look here, at the Earth, our mother, our womb.  She deserves our loyalty and protection. And yet you spoil her lands, poison her oceans, blacken her skies. You're killing her.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Your intentions are noble, but no diesel fuel for heat.  No coolants to preserve food.  Millions would die of cold and hunger alone.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Acceptable losses in a battle to save the planet.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: People come first, Dr. Isley.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Tell me, billionaire, would you warm faster to my pleas if I looked more like Ms. January here?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Although the Wayne Foundation is hosting the event, sadly I will be unable to attend.  Thank you all.  Good day, Doctor.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Physical perfection, charm and wealth tossed over for a dowdy spinster. How do you explain your behavior?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I can't.  But perhaps tonight, over dinner...I've just had an opening.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Maybe your witless playboy persona works on every bimbo du jour but I am not the least bit titillated by your attentions.  So back off or I'll have you in court quicker than you can spell sexual harassment.  Got me?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No!?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Umm.  What I mean is...no plans at the moment...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: But soon...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Can I get some help over here?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You're not even listening to me.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What?  I'm sorry.  You were saying...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: We've been going out over a year now and...Okay, here goes.  Bruce, I want to spend my life with you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Julie, I'm not the marrying kind. There are things about me you wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I know you're a dedicated bachelor. That you've had a your wild nights.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Wild doesn't exactly cover it.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: But there's nothing you've done under the cover of darkness I couldn't learn to understand.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I wouldn't bet on that.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm betting on you.  You'll make someone a good husband one day. But I can't wait around forever. Don't answer now.  Just think it over.  Here's some food for thought.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Who's Ivy?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You just called me Ivy.  Who's Ivy?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I wish I knew.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Dr. Isley.  it was like I could feel you in the room.  You're...enchanting. Gorgeous.  The most beautiful woman I've ever seen.  If you're..um... free...this evening.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Bruce?  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Make a choice, Bruce.  Her or me.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well...um...her.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You were right.  I get it.  You're not the marrying kind.  You've made your point.  Goodbye Bruce Wayne.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: That's gotta hurt.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Somehow he survived.  But the cryoslution mutated his body.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: What happened to his wife?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Presumed dead.  No one knows.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He needs extreme cold to survive. His cryo-suit uses diamond enhanced lasers to keep him at zero degrees.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Let me get this straight. A brilliant citizen, disfigured by a horrible accident, re-emerges as a psychotic super-villain bent on theft, revenge and destruction. You see a pattern here?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: <		Maybe it's something in the water.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I need the Wayne Diamonds.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: We gonna trap ourselves a snowman?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Absolutely.  Just as soon as you take ten hours training in the simulator.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Whoa, I made a mistake.  I'm sorry. Don't go all protective on me.  It won't happen again.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Dick, you were reckless.  You could have been killed.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I'm fine.  See.  Me.  here.  Alive. How are we gonna work together if you're never going to trust me?
